intro: Seddera schizantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf seddera, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows from a basal rosette of fleshy, narrow leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are usually small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and come in shades of pink or white. Seddera schizantha is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
